title: Why is Rylai's getting a 40% slow to AOE skills?
body:
Is this a sick joke? Frozen Mallet costs more and gives MELEE autoattacks a 40% slow. 

Darius and Jax autoattacking you in melee range deserves the same slow as Kog'Maw spamming his ultimate from 2000 range? How did this idea even become considered?

Rylai's + Wota + Liandry's on the PBE allows champs like Rumble to drain tank champions like Mundo from full HP while shredding them tanks to rylai's + liandrys and kiting them with 40% slows

replies.body: they knew it would piss you off so they put it in just for you to make this QQ thread

Slow was increased, duration was reduced

And contrary to popular belief kog ult is a skill shot, jax AA is a right click

Spells can be blocked or absorbed, the only person who can block an auto attack is pantheon

Am I saying it is a a balanced change? No

But you are comparing apples to oranges, especially considering how consistent an AA can go off VS a spell

I typically want Swifts against Ashe or Sej but both of them have hard cc on top of their slows so the item feels a lot less helpful. Rumble actually wouldn't have a 40% slow. He'd have a 20% because his Q is a continuous damage effect. Any kind of DoT or multiple hit effect is only a 20% slow.

I'm more scared of the Liandry's buff on him. 30 more AP terrifies me.
Maybe it is to end the tank meta. Thank god for that.

I'll take tank meta over assassin meta any day.
At least with tank meta positioning, team fights, and [outside LCS] team comp matter.

League of assassins was pretty much "first one to go in wins".

Non-instant AoE's are harder to land in a mobility meta. The upper end of AP builds has been nerfed, meaning mobile champions have longer to escape from burst. Slow utility can counteract this (albiet poorly).

Also, spells are married to CDs, you can eternally apply autos.
Not even in PBE yet dude, chill. and they reduced the time to 1 sec

These Rylai's changes are going to make champions with fast-proccing slows on AoE abilities absolutely disgusting, such as Azir. You won't be able to get out of his soldier range as an ADC without dying instantly, especially if he has Nashor's Tooth.
The item was in a good place but now its going to be oppressive beyond belief.
Replace {{item:3083}} with {{item:3027}}. Better sustain, more mana for {{item:3040}}. Not to mention the extra AP.

I like the shield on seraphs. And most games aren't long enough to justify 2 scaling items. (hell, it's rare to even finish 6 items.)
Generally, I like to start tear -> banner -> ZZ'rot / Nashors
Tear also lets him maintain strong lane dominance better than catalyst.
That said though, it's really a matter of preference.
hes saying to replace warmongs with a ROA and KEEP seraphs
And he is saying most games arent long enough to justify 2 scaling items so AA > RoA for him

RoA stacks in 10 minutes.  If you get RoA by 15 minutes, it's fully powered by time most games end.

Also, it's irrelevant that AA > RoA, he's not saying to get rid of AA.

If I rush RoA and get it by 15 minutes, it'll be fully stacked by 25 minutes.
AA will also be stacked by about 25 minutes if rushed.
If I get them together, they'll both be fully stacked by about 30-35 minutes.
An average game ends before 40 minutes.

So ball park, I'm looking at 10 minutes or less of full power. In exchange, I don't see a meaningful power spike until about 20-25 minutes (depending in how well early game goes).
If I'm in a pre-made team (or one with really good communication) and a late game styled team comp/strategy, then both is perfectly viable. But most matches, I have to balance early game with late game especially since Azir's strength bottoms out mid game. Running 2 scaling items doesn't accomplish that.
When I played anivia, before the tank meta, when games would last 20-30 min I'd have both ROA and AA stacked by the 25 min....

Not in my experience. I play Anivia when I mid, typical build order is {{item:3070}} {{item:3010}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3258}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3040}} and everything is stacked and ready by the first inhib turret.

game is almost decided by the first inhib turret (90% of the times)

It may help to remember the new changes to the defensive masteries. A mastery for 2 points at the first tier will give you a 15% reduction in all slows on your champion. Also, 10% tenacity. So, people will easily be able to mitigate it to an extent.
Xypherous has his heart in the right place, but holy cow somebody should deal with the numbers for him.
